title: Homework 2
text:
Homework 2 is due 9/22/2024 at 11:59 PM. Submit your homework on Canvas as one PDF document.

Show that the moment generating function for a random variable \(X\sim Gamma(\alpha,\beta)\) is \(\left(1-\beta t\right)^{-\alpha}\).
Let \(X\) be a discrete random variable with PMF
\[
P(X=x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}
0.25+0.5e^{-\theta} & x =0 \\
0.25+0.5\theta e^{-\theta} & x =1 \\
0.5\frac{\theta^x}{x!}e^{-\theta} & x = 2,3,\ldots\\
0 & \textrm{otherwise}
\end{array}\right.
\] Show that the PMF is valid.
Let \(X\) and \(Y\) be two random variables that have the following joint distribution function:

\[
f(x,y)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}
e^{-x/2}ye^{-yÂ²} & x>0;y>0\\
0 & \mathrm{otherwise}
\end{array}
\right.
\]
What is the marginal distribution of \(Y\)?

Find the moment-generating function of \(X\sim\chi^2_k\) and \(f_X(x)=\frac{x^{k/2-1}\exp\{-x/2\}}{2^{k/2}\Gamma(k/2)}\) with \(x>0\).
